com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event

Interface CommandListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GenericExceptionListener

    public interface CommandListener
extends GenericExceptionListener
    A CommandListener handles all the command related events.

    Command are triggered by calling VerifyClient.command(String, String, Command, CommandListener)

      The available commands are:
    • Command.LOGOUT
    • Command.CANCEL Note: verification requests cannot be cancelled within the first 30 seconds.
    • Command.TRIGGER_NEXT_EVENT

    Make sure the user is in the right status when trying to perform a command, otherwise a VerifyError.INVALID_USER_STATUS_FOR_COMMAND error will be triggered.

    Remember to set CommandListener in order to receive command updates.

    Example usage, performing a Command.LOGOUT for an already verified user: 

         VerifyClient myVerifyClient = new VerifyClient(myNexmoClient);
     myVerifyClient.command(myCountryCode, myPhoneNo, Command.LOGOUT new CommandListener() {
         @Override
         public void onSuccess(Command command) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }

         @Override
         public void onError(Command command, VerifyError errorCode, String errorMessage) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }
     }

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onError(Command command, VerifyError errorCode, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      The request has been rejected.
      void onSuccess(Command command)
      Indicates the command request was successful.

        onException

    • Method Detail

      • onSuccess

        void onSuccess(Command command)
        Indicates the command request was successful.
        Parameters:
        command - The command that was issued.

      • onError

        void onError(Command command,
           VerifyError errorCode,
           java.lang.String errorMessage)
        The request has been rejected.
          For example, user had an invalid status for the command action: VerifyError.INVALID_USER_STATUS_FOR_COMMAND
        • Calling VerifyClient.command(String, String, Command, CommandListener) with Command.LOGOUT action cannot be accomplished for an unverified user.
        • Calling VerifyClient.command(String, String, Command, CommandListener) with Command.CANCEL action cannot be accomplished for a user that is not in UserStatus.USER_PENDING state.
        Parameters:
        command - The command that was issued.
        errorCode - The VerifyError codes to describe the error.
        errorMessage - The message that describes the VerifyError.
